business.headline: Planning to exit NPS? Here's how the new rules affect your retirement payoutThe pension regulator has eased NPS exit rules, allowing subscribers to access more of their money upfront. If retirement is around the corner, these changes could directly impact your final payout.

Vedanta shares in focus as it gets NCLT approval for demerger. Check detailsVedanta share price: The approval clears a key legal hurdle and allows the company to move ahead with splitting its businesses into multiple listed entities.
Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher as banking stocks rally in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 91.32 points to 84,771.18, while the NSE Nifty50 added 44.40 points to 25,904.50 as of 9:22 am.
Bharat Taxi app to launch in Delhi from January 1The app is expected to provide relief to passengers who often face sharp fare increases on platforms such as Ola and Uber during peak hours.

Warner Bros likely to skip Paramount's $108.4 billion bid, back Netflix: ReportIf the board moves ahead with this recommendation, it would signal Warner Bros Discovery's preference to back Netflix's earlier buyout proposal instead of Paramount's all-cash offer.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO allotment today: Check status, GMP, expected share priceInvestors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status through the registrar, Kfin Technologies, or the BSE website once the allotment is finalised.

100% FDI in insurance explained: What it means for your policies, premiums and claimsWhat does allowing 100% foreign investment in insurance really mean for you as a policyholder, and could it change your premiums, policy features or claim experience? Find out here.

China Eastern Airlines to run daily flights on Delhi-Shanghai route from JanuaryFlight services between the two countries were suspended following the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020 and were not restored due to the over four-year border face-off in eastern Ladakh, which ended in October last year.

Rupee hits historic low of 91 against US dollar. What's behind this drop?The rupee breached the 91 mark against the US dollar for the first time on Tuesday, extending its run of losses amid sustained foreign fund outflows and market uncertainty.

Missed the December advance tax deadline? This is the interest you may have to payIf you missed the December advance tax deadline, don't panic just yet. There is no direct penalty, but interest will apply. Here's what the Income Tax Act says and how much it may cost you.
Sensex ends 533 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; Axis Bank down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 533.50 points to close at 84,679.86, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 167.20 points to end at 25,860.10.

India loses billions yearly as global finance favours rich nations: ReportPoorer and emerging economies like India consistently pay more to the global financial system than they receive back, while rich countries continue to benefit from lower costs and higher returns.​

Will your loan EMI fall? SBI cuts lending rates, lowers interest on select FDThe State Bank of India has announced reductions in both lending and select deposit rates, aiming to balance relief for borrowers with steady returns for most deposit holders.

Gifts from family are tax-free. But who exactly qualifies as 'family'?Received money or property from a family member and assumed it is tax-free? Do you know whether the Income Tax Act actually treats that person as 'family'? Let's find out.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO GMP today. Check allotment and listing detailsThe trend in the unofficial market has strengthened as the ICICI Prudential AMC IPO moved closer to closing, supported by improving subscription numbers across investor categories.

How is young India really investing money? Hint: It's not just stocks or gadgetsFrom digital assets to experiences, India's younger generation is investing in ways that reflect changing priorities and lifestyles. Let's have a look.

Who is Meesho founder Vidit Aatrey, latest entrant to India's billionaire clubVidit Aatrey, the co-founder of Meesho Ltd, has entered the billionaire club as the company's shares climbed sharply to hit a fresh 52-week high in today's trade.

Income Tax Department flags fake donation claims, tightens checks on tax refundsSeveral taxpayers claimed refunds by showing fake donations to political parties and charitable institutions, often with the help of intermediaries. The Income Tax department has now warned that such practices are under close watch.

8th Pay Commission arrears to start from January 1, 2026? Here's latest updateIn November 2025, central government approved the terms of reference for the 8th Pay Commission and granted it 18 months to submit its report.
Sensex opens 300 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Eternal down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 381.44 points to 84,831.92, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 114.55 points to 25,912.75 as of 9:40 am.

entertainment.headline: Emily in Paris Season 5: Release date, plot details and what to expect The fifth season of the Netflix series Emily in Paris will premiere worldwide in December 2025. All ten episodes release at once, with viewers following Emily's new challenges as she relocates to Rome and leads Agence Grateau's new office.

Taskaree teaser: Emraan Hashmi set to crack The Smuggler's Web. Release date out Netflix has announced the premiere of Taskaree: The Smuggler's Web, a crime thriller series starring Emraan Hashmi as a customs officer unravelling international smuggling networks. The series, produced by Friday Storytellers and created by Neeraj Pandey, will begin streaming on January 14, 2026.

Riteish Deshmukh wraps Raja Shivaji with a poetic note: Sun paused for a moment... The filming for Marathi cinema's much-awaited historical epic Raja Shivaji, directed by Riteish Deshmukh, has concluded. The production is now moving into its final phase ahead of a global release set for May 2026.

Rashmika Mandanna enjoys girls trip in Sri Lanka, fans ask if it's bachelorette bash Actor Rashmika Mandanna recently visited Sri Lanka with friends, sharing glimpses of the getaway on social media, which sparked fan speculation about a possible bachelorette celebration.

Preity Zinta praises Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar, calls it a masterpiece Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar continues its blockbuster run, crossing Rs 400 crore in India and nearly Rs 600 crore worldwide, while earning glowing praise from Bollywood celebrities. Preity Zinta called the Aditya Dhar directorial a "masterpiece," lauding its performances, music and heartfelt storytelling.

Dhurandhar's Lutt Le Gaya was made just 10 days before release, singer Simran Dhurandhar's song Lutt Le Gaya, created in a spontaneous six-hour session just days before the film's release, has become a major musical sensation across India. Singer-songwriter Simran Choudhary reflects on the unexpected journey of the track.

Homebound Oscars shortlist: Bollywood celebs cheer, congratulate Karan Johar Karan Johar's Homebound, directed by Neeraj Ghaywan, has been shortlisted for Best International Feature Film at the 98th Academy Awards. The announcement saw a wave of congratulatory messages from celebrities and fans.

BB19 winner Gaurav Khanna launches YouTube channel, opens up about his journey After winning Bigg Boss 19, Gaurav Khanna has launched his own YouTube channel to stay connected with fans and share his personal journey. In his first video, the actor reflects on his career, values, Bigg Boss experience, and expresses gratitude to Salman Khan and his supporters.

Lady Gaga halts Sydney concert after dancer falls off stage. Watch viral video Lady Gaga briefly halted her Sydney concert after dancer Michael Dameski slipped off stage during heavy rain, assuring fans of his safety as he later confirmed he was unharmed.

Akhanda 2 box office Day 5: Rs 70 crore for Balayya, film struggles during weekdays Nandamuri Balakrishna's Akhanda 2: Thaandavam has surpassed Rs 70-crore mark in India. However, it witnessed a decline in numbers during the weekdays.

Dhurandhar box office Day 12: Ranveer's film roars globally, crosses Rs 600 crore Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar continued its unstoppable box office run, crossing the Rs 600 crore mark worldwide by day 12.
Rolling Stones cancel 2026 tour, Keith Richards cites health concerns The Rolling Stones have cancelled their anticipated 2026 stadium tour of the UK and Europe.

Dileep's biggest career test: Can Bha Bha Ba deliver a post-acquittal comeback? Malayalam star Dileep faces a crucial career moment with Bha Bha Ba releasing on December 18 after his acquittal. The film's success could determine his comeback amid ongoing public controversies.

Barack and I were to meet Rob Reiner, Michele on the day they died: Michelle Obama Michelle Obama has revealed that she and former President Barack Obama were scheduled to meet Rob and Michele Reiner on the night the couple was found dead.

Ishaan Khatter's Homebound makes it to 2026 Oscar shortlist. Karan Johar thrilled Homebound, India's official entry, has been shortlisted among 15 films for the Best International Feature Film at the 98th Academy Awards. The film, directed by Neeraj Ghaywan and produced by Karan Johar, is now one step closer to Oscar final nominations.

From Khilji to Hamza: Dhurandhar Ranveer Singh's chameleon run in Bollywood Ranveer Singh shifts his shape into a new character with each film. Dhurandhar, directed by Aditya Dhar, stars him as Indian spy Hamza in Pakistan. His transformative role highlights the dedication of those protecting the country from the shadows.

Rob Reiner, wife Michele's throats were slit: New details emerge in murder case Police investigate fatal stabbing of filmmaker Rob Reiner and his wife Michele in Brentwood, Los Angeles, after their bodies were found by a family member. The couple's son, Nick, has been arrested in connection with the murders.

Reiner murders: Son Nick charged as District Attorney considers death penalty Los Angeles County District Attorney Nathan J Hochman has announced charges against Nick Reiner for the murders of his parents, Rob and Michele Reiner, following their discovery at their Brentwood home.

Saumya Tandon praises Ranveer's maturity: He's giving the stage to Akshaye Saumya Tandon discussed Ranveer Singh's role in the film Dhurandhar, calling attention to his mature approach as praise continues to center on Akshaye Khanna. The film has surpassed the Rs 400 crore mark across India.

general news.headline: Function at 50% WFH or pay fine: Delhi's mandate to government, private firmsThe Delhi government on Wednesday mandated all government and private companies to function at a 50 per cent work from home mode amid the pollution crisis.

Luthras taken to Goa, cops say they had ultimate control over club operationsGoa Police, while seeking transit remand, said the Luthra brothers were the main owners of the nightclub, where a fire killed 25 people, and had 'ultimate control' over the operation and safety arrangement.

Bondi Beach shooter wakes up from coma, arrested at bedside for terror, murdersNaveed Akram, the surviving Bondi Beach terrorist, came out of coma and was arrested at the bedside at a hospital in Australia. He has been charged with one count of terror and 15 murders. Naveed survived while his father Sajid Akram, originally from India, was shot dead by the police as the duo killed 15 civilians.

Prithviraj Chavan sparks row with 'India defeated on Op Sindoor day 1' commentFormer Maharashtra Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan said that Indian aircraft were shot down on the first day of Operation Sindoor and India was completely defeated.

Messi goes desi: Football great prays, poses with tiger at Anant Ambani's VantaraVantara founder Anant Ambani hosted global football icon Lionel Messi at the wildlife rescue, rehabilitation and conservation centre, where the football legend's time was marked by guided tours, traditional rituals and close interactions with wildlife.

IPL 2026 auction report card: Rating the squads of all 10 teamsIPL 2026 mini-auction: Big money, bold calls and surprise steals defined the Abu Dhabi show, where all 10 teams finalised their squads after a series of fierce bidding wars on December 16. While some franchises splurged on marquee names, uncapped Indian players were also among the biggest winners as teams looked to strengthen their core. Here's how all 10 squads shaped up after an intense eight-hour auction marathon.

Asim Munir's big test as Trump pushes Pakistan to send troops to GazaAsim Munir, who is now Pakistan's chief of defence forces, is expected to fly to Washington to meet President Donald Trump in the coming weeks. The meeting will likely focus on the Gaza stabilisation force.

Not AQI, AQI chants but...: BJP's counter video of Delhi CM at Messi eventDelhi pollution: A clip went viral this week showing Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta facing chants of 'AQI, AQI' from the crowd as she welcomed Messi at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. Now, the BJP has released another clip, claiming it to be the 'real video'.

Is Delhi's smog driving a rush to the hills? Viral video sparks concernA viral video shared on X claims to capture a glimpse of the traffic jam in Himachal, raising concerns about the environmental impact as Delhi residents flock to the hills amid hazardous air quality.

No ambulance, no passerby help: 34-year-old Bengaluru man dies of heart attack on roadA 34-year-old man died after suffering a heart attack on a Bengaluru road on December 13. Despite his wife seeking help, no immediate assistance was available. He died while being rushed to hospital on a two-wheeler.

Ishaan Khatter's Homebound makes it to 2026 Oscar shortlist. Karan Johar thrilledHomebound, India's official entry, has been shortlisted among 15 films for the Best International Feature Film at the 98th Academy Awards. The film, directed by Neeraj Ghaywan and produced by Karan Johar, is now one step closer to Oscar final nominations.

US imposes complete travel ban on 7 more countries, limits entry from 15 othersThe new proclamation is an addition to earlier list of 19 countries, which faced either complete travel ban or partial entry restrictions. With the additions, the list has been expanded to as many as 39 countries and includes Palestinians and Syrians.

Too old to be a mom? Gynaecologists say age should not decide when women have kidsMore women are choosing to focus on careers and personal growth before starting a family. Experts say age alone should not decide when a woman becomes a mother.

As cities choke from toxic air, mountains are paying the priceSustainable tourism strategies, better pollution control and climate resilience measures are increasingly urgent for both cities and the hills that shelter their weary residents.

Bondi Beach terror attack is a reminder that jihadist threat cannot be ignoredThere have been reports of Islamophobic attacks in Australia since the massacre, including one at a Muslim cemetery, where pig heads have been found. This indicates that Australia and the rest of the world must unite to fight terror and hate.
Eggs in India: Separating science, safety and marketing spinFrom viral antibiotic scares to premium branding, a clear-eyed guide to India's most misunderstood protein.

Why do H-1B visa applicants get 221(g) slips? US social media checks explainedThe US State Department expanded social media screening for skilled worker visas from December 15. Instead of an approval or rejection, applicants are now being issued a 221(g) slip.

From Khilji to Hamza: Dhurandhar Ranveer Singh's chameleon run in BollywoodRanveer Singh shifts his shape into a new character with each film. Dhurandhar, directed by Aditya Dhar, stars him as Indian spy Hamza in Pakistan. His transformative role highlights the dedication of those protecting the country from the shadows.

Video: Masked Brown University suspected shooter recces campus day before attackThe new surveillance video, tweeted by FBI Director Kash Patel, showed the suspected shooter walking around multiple pavements near the Brown University engineering building where the shooting occurred that killed two and wounded nine others.

This shaadi season, couples are saying yes to crochet varmalasWith hyper-personalisation being one of India's biggest wedding trends, crochet jaimalas have become a sure-shot favourite for couples seeking bespoke, made-from-scratch garlands.

New Bill, same concern: Will VB-G RAM G miss 125-day rural work target?As Parliament debates a Bill to replace MGNREGA, concerns remain about whether an increase in guaranteed employment from the current 120 days to 125 days and a new name (VB-G RAM G) will translate into real benefits for rural households.

Case against Shilpa Shetty co-owned pub in Bengaluru for late-night operationsPolice registered suo motu cases against two Bengaluru pubs, including Bastian Garden City, for operating beyond permitted hours. The action followed viral videos showing a scuffle and late-night operations.

Dad's Army to T20 babies: CSK reset DNA, but did they get the auction wrong?IPL auction 2026: A radical shift in philosophy has turned the Dad's Army into a nursery. But with a surplus of batters and a void at the death, have CSK sacrificed balance for youth?

sports.headline: Yashasvi Jaiswal hospitalised with stomach cramps during domestic T20 in Pune India batter Yashasvi Jaiswal was hospitalised with acute gastroenteritis after the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match between Mumbai and Rajasthan.

Cameron Green a generational talent, CSK missed a trick letting him go: R Ashwin R Ashwin said CSK showed a lack of intent at the IPL 2026 mini-auction, allowing KKR to snap up generational all-rounder Cameron Green for a record Rs 25.20 crore, a move he hailed as an outstanding buy.

IPL auction: Sarthak Ranjan, son of Congress leader Pappu Yadav picked up by KKR KKR's IPL 2026 auction included a notable off-field moment as the franchise signed Sarthak Ranjan, son of former MP and Congress leader Pappu Yadav, prompting an emotional reaction from the Bihar politician.

Prithvi Shaw's 2nd chance: DC co-owner on why they bid for Maharashtra batter DC co-owner Kiran Kumar Grandhi explained why the franchise decided to bring back Prithvi Shaw into the side during the IPL 2026 auction. Shaw was bought back by DC for his base price of Rs. 75 Lakh.

Joe Burns snubbed for Italy's maiden T20 World Cup campaign in India and Sri Lanka T20 World Cup 2026: The Italian Cricket Federation has confirmed Wayne Madsen as the new captain of the men's T20 team, replacing Joe Burns, who will not be part of the squad for the upcoming ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

Auqib Nabi's 8.4 crore deal in IPL auction gives J&K cricket the hope it needs At 29, Auqib Nabi Dar turned years of waiting into an IPL breakthrough, carrying the Valley with him and giving J&K cricket a moment it had long dreamed of.

Australia, England players pay homage to Bondi beach terror attack victims Australia and England cricket teams paid respects to the Bondi beach attack victims on Day 1 of the third Ashes Test at the Adelaide Oval. Fifteen civilians were killed and dozens injured on Sunday at Bondi Beach after two men opened fire, targeting members of the Jewish community.

Dad's Army to T20 babies: CSK reset DNA, but did they get the auction wrong? IPL auction 2026: A radical shift in philosophy has turned the Dad's Army into a nursery. But with a surplus of batters and a void at the death, have CSK sacrificed balance for youth?

4th T20I: Suryakumar, Gill under the pump as India eye series win in Lucknow India will look to clinch the T20I series against South Africa in the fourth match in Lucknow on December 17. The spotlight will be once again on Shubman Gill and Suryakumar Yadav's form as the team prepares for the T20 World Cup 2026 on home soil.

IPL auction: Why uncapped Indian stars sold like hot cakes in Abu Dhabi The IPL 2026 auction saw teams deviate from their usual approach and splash the cash on uncapped Indian talent. With names like Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma stealing the spotlight, here a look at why uncapped stars went for big money during the auction on December 16.

Ashes: Why Khawaja is playing after being left out of Xi on eve of 3rd Test Usman Khawaja was a late inclusion in Australia's playing XI for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide after Steve Smith was ruled out due to illness. Khawaja was slotted in to Smith's number four spot in the batting lineup.

IPL 2026 auction report card: Rating the squads of all 10 teamsIPL 2026 mini-auction: Big money, bold calls and surprise steals defined the Abu Dhabi show, where all 10 teams finalised their squads after a series of fierce bidding wars on December 16. While some franchises splurged on marquee names, uncapped Indian players were also among the biggest winners as teams looked to strengthen their core. Here's how all 10 squads shaped up after an intense eight-hour auction marathon.

IPL 2026 auction review: 10 things we learnt from bidding wars in Abu DhabiIPL Auction: The Indian Premier League mini-auction saw a total of 77 players being sold on Tuesday. Here is a concise review of the event in 10 points. From trust in uncapped players to unique auction strategies, here's everything that unfolded in Abu Dhabi on December 15.

MS Dhoni will surely retire: Ex-CSK teammate makes big claim after mini-auctionIPL 2026 auction: Former CSK batter Robin Uthappa says MS Dhoni's final act is imminent, citing the franchise's youth-focused auction strategy as a clear sign of the legend's impending transition to a mentor role.

Forever grateful to Dhoni bhai, CSK: Pathirana's emotional note to ChennaiMatheesha wrote an emotional message to CSK, MS Dhoni and fans of Chennai after the Sri Lankan pacer moved on to join KKR during the IPL 2026 auction on Tuesday, December 26. Pathirana spent four seasons with CSK.

If corporates, fans can pay for Messi, they can back Indian football: BhaichungSpeaking to India Today's Consulting Editor Rajdeep Sardesai, Indian football great Bhaichung Bhutia urged corporates and fans, who paid big money to watch Lionel Messi on his GOAT tour in India, to support Indian football.

IPL 2026 Auction: Meet Prashant Veer, The ₹14.20 Crore Uncapped Star Bought By CSKIn this special report, RD INDIA TODAY speaks to Prashant Veer, the uncapped cricketer from Uttar Pradesh who created history at the IPL 2026 auction. The 20-year-old all-rounder was bought by Chennai Super Kings (CSK) for a staggering ₹14.20 crore. Prashant shares his excitement about joining his 'dream team' and the prospect of sharing the dressing room with MS Dhoni. He says, 'I am very excited to meet Dhoni. I will try to learn as much as I can from him.' He reflects on his journey from the UP T20 League, where he shone for Noida Super Kings, to becoming one of the most expensive uncapped players. He also credits his coach Raju Goyal and the UPCA for their support.

Messi goes desi: Football great prays, poses with tiger at Anant Ambani's VantaraVantara founder Anant Ambani hosted global football icon Lionel Messi at the wildlife rescue, rehabilitation and conservation centre, where the football legend's time was marked by guided tours, traditional rituals and close interactions with wildlife.

Shaw returns home to DC: Maharashtra batter reacts after IPL 2026 auction dealPrithvi Shaw posted an emotional message after the former India U-19 captain returned to his former side during the IPL 2026 auction.

MS Dhoni fan Kartik Sharma in tears after fetching record Rs 14.2 crore from CSKMS Dhoni fan Kartik Sharma revealed that he broke down after seeing the bidding war for him during the IPL 2026 auction. Kartik became the joint-costliest uncapped player in the history of the IPL.

Suryakumar can win you 5 out 5 games alone: Dube backs out-of-form India captainAll-rounder Shivam Dube on Tuesday backed out-of-form India T20 captain Suryakumar Yadav, describing him as a player capable of winning matches single-handedly and insisting that his touch will return at the right time.

IPL auction: CSK reward Sarfaraz Khan's resilience, Delhi buy Prithvi ShawIPL 2026 auction: Sarfaraz Khan secured an IPL contract with Chennai Super Kings for Rs 75 lakh in the 2026 mini-auction. After missing out on the last two seasons, the Mumbai batter, who has worked hard on his fitness, will be back in the IPL.

Prashant Veer surprised with Rs 14.20 crore CSK deal: Didn't expect this muchIPL 2026: In an interview with India Today, Prashant Veer said that he was surprised after the Chennai Super Kings bought him for Rs 14.20 crore in the auction on Tuesday in Abu Dhabi.

Mustafizur Rahman shatters records, becomes most expensive Bangladesh player in IPLMustafizur Rahman made history at the IPL 2026 auction as Kolkata Knight Riders snapped him up for Rs 9.20 crore after a fierce bidding war, making him the most expensive Bangladeshi player ever and reinforcing his value as a proven match-winning T20 pacer.

Uncapped players rule IPL auction: Massive hikes for lesser-known facesIt was a field day for Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma as CSK broke the bank to bring the uncapped stars home. Here's a look at the six players who saw an incredible price rise during the IPL 2026.

Prashant Veer exclusive: Mahi bhai's CSK pays this Yuvraj Singh fan Rs 14.2 croreIPL Auction 2026: Uttar Pradesh's Prashant Veer was signed by Chennai Super Kings for Rs 14.20 crore at the Indian Premier League auction held in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday. In an interview with India Today, Prashant spoke about his excitement at the prospect of playing alongside MS Dhoni and named Yuvraj Singh as his idol.

Paris St Germain ordered to pay Kylian Mbappe 60 million eurosParis St-Germain have been ordered by a French court to pay former striker Kylian Mbappe 60 million euros (£52.5 million) in unpaid salary and bonuses.

Jadeja 2.0? CSK buy uncapped Prashant Veer for record sum of Rs 14.2 croreIPL 2026 auction: Chennai Super Kings bought spin-bowling all-rounder Prashant Veer for Rs 14.20 crore, making him the joint-most expensive uncapped player in the history of the auction. They also spent Rs 14.2 crore for Rajasthan's Kartik Sharma.

New Dhoni in making? CSK make Kartik Sharma joint-most expensive uncapped playerCSK have identified their long-term replacement for MS Dhoni as they made Kartik Sharma the joint-most expensive uncapped player in the history of the IPL auction.

Who is Auqib Nabi? J&K all-rounder bags Rs 8.40 crore IPL deal with DCIPL 2026 Auction: Delhi Capitals bought Jammu and Kashmir all-rounder Auqib Nabi Dar for Rs 8.40 crore at the IPL 2026 auction, which is being held in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
